title: Tempura
description: Light and crispy Japanese tempura made with shrimp and vegetables dipped in airy batter and deep-fried until golden.
instructions: Peel and devein the shrimp, keeping the tails intact. Cut the vegetables into thin, uniform slices for even frying.
In a bowl, lightly beat the egg and mix in the cold water. Add the flour gently and stir briefly, leaving some lumps to ensure a light batter.
Heat oil in a deep pan to 170–180°C.
Dip the shrimp and vegetables individually into the batter, ensuring they are lightly coated.
Fry a few pieces at a time until they turn light golden and crispy, about 2–3 minutes per batch.
Place them on a paper towel to drain excess oil before serving.
